[SEC] 1. Introduction.[SUBSEC] 1.1 Purpose: The Registered Mail Delivery Tracking System (RMDTS) defines requirements for managing registered mail deliveries, including tracking, logging, and reporting within assigned areas.
[SEC] 1. Introduction.[SUBSEC] 1.2 Scope: RMDTS supports tracking of registered mail deliveries, including letters and parcels, by assigned mail carriers.

[SUBSEC] 1.3 Product Perspective.[SUBSUBSEC] 1.3.1 System Interfaces: RMDTS integrates with postal service databases for tracking registered mail.
[SUBSEC] 1.3 Product Perspective.[SUBSUBSEC] 1.3.3 Hardware Interfaces: RMDTS supports barcode scanners for registered mail tracking.
[SUBSEC] 1.3 Product Perspective.[SUBSUBSEC] 1.3.4 Software Interfaces: RMDTS uses relational databases and REST APIs for delivery tracking.
[SUBSEC] 1.3 Product Perspective.[SUBSUBSEC] 1.3.5 Communications Interfa: RMDTS secures data transmission through encryption.
[SUBSEC] 1.3 Product Perspective.[SUBSUBSEC] 1.3.6 Memory Constraints: RMDTS is optimized for high-volume mail delivery data storage.
[SUBSEC] 1.3 Product Perspective.[SUBSUBSEC] 1.3.7 Operations: RMDTS manages registered mail deliveries, tracking mail carriers and recipients.
[SUBSEC] 1.3 Product Perspective.[SUBSUBSEC] 1.3.8 Site Adaptation Requir: RMDTS is configurable for various geographical areas and postal service policies.
[SUBSEC] 1.3 Product Perspective.[SUBSUBSEC] 1.3.9 Interfaces with Servic: RMDTS connects with postal tracking, notifications, and logistics databases.
[SUBSEC] 1.3 Product Perspective.[SUBSUBSEC] 1.3.2 MISSING-TAG2: RMDTS allows mail carriers and postal service staff to log deliveries.

[SEC] 1. Introduction.[SUBSEC] 1.4 Product Functions: RMDTS tracks registered mail, including letters, parcels, assigned carriers, recipients, timestamps, and status updates.
[SEC] 1. Introduction.[SUBSEC] 1.5 User Characteristics: RMDTS is designed for postal staff, carriers, and recipients needing delivery updates and proof of receipt.
[SEC] 1. Introduction.[SUBSEC] 1.6 Limitations: RMDTS requires network connectivity for tracking updates.
[SUBSEC] 1.8 Definitions: Registered Mail: Mail requiring tracking and confirmation.
[SEC] 1. Introduction.[SUBSEC] 1.7 MISSING-TAG1: RMDTS relies on accurate address records and assigned mail carrier data.

[SUBSEC] 2.1 External Interfaces.REQ-INTF-001: The system shall store and manage registered mail deliveries, including letters and parcels (REQ-DB-001).
[SUBSEC] 2.1 External Interfaces.REQ-INTF-002: The system shall track mail carriers assigned to registered mail deliveries (REQ-DB-002).

[SUBSEC] 2.2 Functions.REQ-FUNC-001: The system shall record each registered mail delivery, including the recipient and the delivering mail carrier (REQ-DB-001, REQ-DB-002).
[SUBSEC] 2.2 Functions.REQ-FUNC-002: The system shall allow multiple mail carriers to operate within the same geographical area and track which carrier delivered each registered mail item (REQ-DB-002).
[SUBSEC] 2.2 Functions.REQ-FUNC-003: The system shall provide tracking for both letters and parcels (REQ-DB-001).

[SUBSEC] 2.3 Usability Requirements.REQ-USAB-001: The system shall provide an intuitive interface for logging mail entries, tracking delivery progress, and generating reports on mail status and carrier efficiency.

[SUBSEC] 2.4 Performance Requirements.REQ-PERF-001: The system shall update delivery records within 1 second of a delivery event.

[SUBSEC] 2.5 Logical Database Requiremen.REQ-DB-001: The system shall store registered mail details, including type, recipient, and delivery status.
[SUBSEC] 2.5 Logical Database Requiremen.REQ-DB-002: The system shall maintain records of mail carriers assigned to deliveries.

[SUBSEC] 2.6 Design Constraints.REQ-DSGN-001: The system shall enforce unique identification for registered mail items and mail carriers.

[SUBSEC] 2.7 Standards Compliance.REQ-COMP-001: The system shall comply with postal service tracking regulations.

[SUBSEC] 2.8 MISSING-TAG3.REQ-ATTR-001: The system shall log all registered mail deliveries and carrier assignments.

[SEC] 3. Verification: Unit and integration tests validate mail delivery tracking, carrier assignments, and registered mail processing.
[SEC] 4. Supporting Information: User guides, API documentation, and postal service policies.
[SEC] 5. References: Postal tracking standards, delivery regulations, and service policies.
